articles.title: U.S. Will be Held Accountable for Outbreak of War on Korean Peninsula: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry
articles.content:
U.S. Will be Held Accountable for Outbreak of War on Korean Peninsula: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK released a statement on Wednesday as regards the fact that the U.S. is driving the situation on the Korean peninsula to an ever more extreme phase through profound confusion of right and wrong.
					 The statement recalled the fact that a spokesman for the U.S. State Department on Monday malignantly pulled up the DPRK over the warning served by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army with regard to the "special operation" staged by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces, terming it "provocative act" and "inflammatory remarks."
					
					 The warning is an entirely just measure for self-defence against the heinous provocateurs given the prevailing situation that has reached a phase which can never be overlooked, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 After kicking off joint military drills involving hundreds of thousands of troops and nuclear strategic assets, the U.S. is staging a "special operation" drill, the keynote of which are a "beheading operation" for "eliminating the headquarters" of a sovereign state and a "preemptive strike" operation designed to destroy its nuclear and rocket bases. Clear is its ulterior design.
					
					 The U.S. has worked hard to justify the war rehearsals, talking about their transparency, but it is no more than a paradox.
					
					 Its trumpeting about transparency is just outbursts of a gangster to commit robbery in broad daylight.
					
					 As the strategic depth of the DPRK is not big, the only way to defend itself from the sudden preemptive attack from the U.S. modern strategic assets and special warfare units is just to mount a resolute preemptive attack.
					
					 In case a war breaks out on the Korean peninsula, the U.S. will be held wholly accountable for it, no matter who will launch a preemptive attack, as it is causing trouble by bringing lots of nuclear strategic assets and special warfare means, not content with persisting in its hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Slams U.S. Racket of Tightening Financial Sanctions
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Slams U.S. Racket of Tightening Financial Sanctions
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA on Wednesday as regards the frantic financial sanctions racket being kicked up by the U.S.-led hostile forces against the DPRK:
					 The U.S.-led hostile forces at a plenary meeting of the International Financial Supervisory Body held in Paris in February last again staged a farce of re-listing the DPRK as a target of "countermeasure" for blocking its financial transactions with other countries. Then, they pressurized the Society for World Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) headquartered in Belgium into terminating its financial communication service to the banks of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. House of Representatives produced a "bill on escalating sanctions with respect to transactions with North Korea" after modifying and supplementing the "North Korea Sanctions and Policy Enhancement Act of 2016." It has gone the lengths of crying out for independent sanctions against banks and businesses of other countries dealing with the DPRK after inventing absurd pretexts.
					
					 The recent racket kicked up by the U.S.-led hostile forces to tighten financial sanctions against the DPRK is no more than a stopgap measure of those being driven into a tight corner in the political and military standoff with the DPRK.
					
					 A step was taken by SWIFT to ban its communication with the banks of the DPRK but the banks of the DPRK have not dealt with the SWIFT since a long time ago in actuality.
					
					 As for the farce staged by the International Financial Supervisory Body to re-list the DPRK as a "target of countermeasure", it is just an unfair one taken under pressure from the U.S., as repeatedly clarified by the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is doing its best after establishing the system of anti-money laundering and combating financing of terrorism in accordance with international standard.
					
					 The independent sanctions the U.S. claims slapping against other countries dealing with the DPRK are also being opposed worldwide as an impudent act of wantonly violating international law.
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that the frantic racket of the U.S. is aimed to tarnish the international image of the DPRK and stir up the international atmosphere of ratcheting up sanctions and pressure upon it.
					
					 The whole gamut of base actions the U.S. and its vassal forces are running to deprive the DPRK of its nuclear weapons under the pretexts of UN sanctions and independent sanctions would only result in bringing into bolder relief the unreasonable and immoral nature of the sanctions.
					
					 They can never check the advance of the DPRK accelerating the building of a socialist power under the unfurled banner of self-reliance and self-development, firmly holding the nuclear deterrent, a treasured sword of victory.

articles.title: Briefing on Situation Given for Diplomatic Envoys of EU Countries Here
articles.content:
Briefing on Situation Given for Diplomatic Envoys of EU Countries Here
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Gyong, director-general of the 2nd Department for European Affairs of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, on Tuesday gave a briefing for diplomatic envoys of EU countries here on the present acute situation prevailing in the Korean peninsula.
					 Kim referred to the present situation of the Korean peninsula that is inching close to the brink of a war due to the largest-ever Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers, staged by the U.S., together with the south Korean forces, in an aim to execute their "beheading operation" and "occupation of Pyongyang" after hurling huge strategic assets, and to the measures for self-defense taken by the DPRK to cope with it.
					
					 The days had gone when one side enforced something on the other side and the DPRK has both will and capability to readily react to any type of war the U.S. wants, the director-general stressed.
					
					 Expressing deep concern about the aggravating situation of the Korean peninsula, those diplomatic envoys hoped that the tension would be ironed out through dialogue.

articles.title: Credentials from Slovenian Ambassador Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials from Slovenian Ambassador Accepted
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Premoze Janez, Slovenian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had talks with the ambassador.

articles.title: First-Term Graduation Ceremony of Pyongyang Int'l Football School Held
articles.content:
First-Term Graduation Ceremony of Pyongyang Int'l Football School Held
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The first-term graduation ceremony of the Pyongyang International Football School took place on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, officials concerned, teaching staff and pupils, graduates and parents of pupils.
					
					 Choe congratulated the first-term graduates on emerging promising football players by bringing their dream and technique into full bloom at the school, a center for training reserve football players.
					
					 He called on the graduates to fully display their technique they have learnt at the best school to fly the national flag of the Republic in international games.
					
					 The graduates planted memorial trees at the end of the ceremony.

articles.title: National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
articles.content:
National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize opened in Pyongyang to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Attending it are more than 600 men and women players selected from 20-odd organizations including Taekwon-Do teams across the country. They will compete in Taekwon-Do, go and other events at the Holy Taekwon-Do Hall.
					
					 The opening ceremony took place at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, officials concerned, players, coaches and citizens.
					
					 Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, made an opening address.
					
					 After the ceremony there were demonstrations by players of the Taekwon-Do team of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee.

articles.title: Forest Science College Established at Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Forest Science College Established at Kim Il Sung University
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Forest Science College came into being at Kim Il Sung University, the highest institute of Juche-oriented science and education in the DPRK.
					 The college will play a core role in carrying out the grand plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for the forest restoration campaign, protecting land and environment and remarkably developing forest science, technology and industry.
					
					 In this regard, Pak Sung Ho, rector of the college, told KCNA:
					
					 Preparations for the establishment of the college successfully came to an end in a short span of time.
					
					 30-odd subjects for forest science were elaborated and teaching plans on these subjects already worked out with new teaching methods.
					
					 The college, which will open on April 1 this year, is fully equipped with educational facilities and apparatuses necessary for providing a world-level educational conditions and circumstances. And the enrollment of students and postgraduates was finished.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Putting Forestation on Scientific Basis
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Putting Forestation on Scientific Basis
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Great efforts have been channeled into implementing the far-reaching plan of the Workers' Party of Korea on land development in the DPRK.
					 Standing in the van are scientists of the Economic Forest Institute under the Academy of Forest Science who have successfully settled problems arising in propagating trees of economic value.
					
					 After finding a solution by rationally combining grafting with dense planting, they succeeded in introducing the technology of creating a grove of pine-nut trees into several hectares of land in Rinsan County, North Hwanghae Province to raise the productivity four times higher and bringing harvest 10 years earlier than before. The same goes for newly-bred chestnut, walnut and other trees of good species.
					
					 From this year, it will be carried out to turn forests of Evodia daniellii into those of high-yielding ones across the country. For this, ten city and county Evodia daniellii forest stations were selected as exemplary units with hundreds of thousands of grafts prepared.
					
					 The scientists are also pushing ahead with preparations for introducing the method of grafting Evodia daniellii and guaranteeing the yield with science.
					
					 At present, it is possible to bring earlier the harvest and raise per-hectare yield 3-4 times higher than before in 2,000-odd hectares of Evodia daniellii forests.
					
					 Scientists are giving a helping hand to concluding the creation of lime-tree forest in Samjiyon County, Ryanggang Province within this year.

articles.title: Exhibition of Building Materials Goes on in DPRK
articles.content:
Exhibition of Building Materials Goes on in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of building materials for sprucing up Samjiyon County is going on at the Sci-Tech Complex in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 More than 630 homemade building materials of over 120 kinds are on display at the exhibition.
					
					 What draws the attention of visitors are building materials made with pumice by the 216 Division.
					
					 Kim Thae Ung, department director of the Central Committee of the Architects Union of Korea, told KCNA:
					
					 Building materials made with pumice have a wide range of use as they are recognized as multipurpose and green building materials in the 21 century.
					
					 They include heat-insulating material, ceiling material, wainscot, flooring material and so on.
					
					 The heat-insulating material weights light and is low in heat conductivity. It makes it possible to fully prevent rottenness and clear up dew point in the interior of building.
					
					 The ceiling material is of great value in providing an architectural environment favorable to human body. 
					
					 Meanwhile, wainscots, flooring materials and light board materials patterned with natural stone, grain of wood, bark, block, etc. are expected to add architectural beauty.

articles.title: DPRK Is Strong Defender of Global Peace: KCNA
articles.content:
DPRK Is Strong Defender of Global Peace: KCNA
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released an article on Tuesday lambasting the U.S. and other hostile forces for pushing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the worst phase with all their strategic assets involved, after labeling the DPRK a "factor of regional instability," taken aback by its ever-increasing might. 
					 The truth and validity of the DPRK's cause of bolstering nuclear weapons for protecting the regional security and global peace at the geopolitical outpost in Northeast Asia can never be confirmed according to the interests of big powers, the article said and went on:
					
					 A fortress of justice strong enough to stand against the hegemony and unipolar rule of the super-empire was built in Northeast Asia. It serves as tremendous muscle for defending peace in the world.
					
					 When World War II was over the U.S. exercised its authority to beat its rival in any matter with an unchallenged right to decide worldwide, but the world political structure and the balance of forces have changed at present.
					
					 A report published by the U.S. Centre for Strategic and International Studies on January 19, 2016 said that the balance of forces in Asia is steadily changing in the direction of running counter to the interests of the U.S.
					
					 This reflects the policy stand of the U.S. displeased with the present timetable for executing its strategy for dominating Asia.
					
					 The commander-in-chief of the U.S. Forces in the Pacific recently underlined the need for the U.S. to maintain the strongest military muscle to counter any country in the areas under its control covering 52 percent of surface of the earth.
					
					 The U.S. recently hurled its F-35B and F-22 Raptor stealth fighters into its bases in Yamaguchi and Okinawa of Japan from its mainland. It staged a precision air raid drill under the simulated conditions of striking pivotal areas of the DPRK with F-35Bs.
					
					 The U.S. is confirming the possibility of an actual war involving a "beheading operation" aimed at "bringing down the social system" of the DPRK and a preemptive strike operation targeting the nuclear means of the DPRK through the largest-ever Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills.
					
					 This is an escalation of the U.S. moves for a nuclear war to stifle the DPRK at any cost and contain the regional big powers by force of arms and a vivid manifestation of its scenario to dominate the world. 
					
					 Big powers are to blame for the escalating tensions in Northeast Asia as they are making no scruple of creating the danger of serious armed clashes for hegemony after expanding the sphere of their interests far beyond the purpose of defending their sovereignty. 
					
					 U.S. Secretary of State Tillerson admitted during his trips to East Asian countries that the policy pursued by the U.S. toward the DPRK for the past 20 years went belly-up.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that world media are warning the U.S. not to make any more mistakes if it came to know that its DPRK policy was wrongly-guided.
					
					 The stability on the Korean peninsula is directly linked to the security not only in Northeast Asia but also in the Asia-Pacific.
					
					 The position of the DPRK as a nuclear power in the East has grown stronger and the strategic structure of the relations among its neighboring countries began to undergo a fundamental change.
					
					 The nukes which the DPRK was compelled to possess for self-defence are preserving peace, stability and prosperity not only of a country or a nation but of the region and the world.
					
					 The nukes of the DPRK are different from the ones of big powers for aggression and intervention.
					
					 All military steps taken by the DPRK are an entirely legitimate exercise of its right to self-defence to cope with the brigandish nuclear blackmail and threat from the U.S. and its vassal forces and their moves to isolate and strangulate the DPRK.
					
					 Justice and truth, equality and respect are now gradually disappearing in the world political arena, but injustice, high-handed and arbitrary practices are prevailing. Some big powers are closeted to conspire against other countries to seek their interests in disregard of the most elementary principles specified by humankind with common agreement. Such situation should never be tolerated.
					
					 There are the forces faulting the nuclear deterrent of the DPRK for self-defence and seeking to fish in the troubled waters by sacrificing the Korean nation while kowtowing to the U.S. keen to dominate the world after occupying the whole of the Korean peninsula, a strategic vantage point. They should behave themselves.
					
					 The viewpoint on the geopolitical position of the Korean peninsula should undergo a due change as required by the strategic position of the DPRK that has ranked itself among the advanced nuclear powers and the developing trend of the times.
					
					 The countries, failing to take a responsible option in dealing with the Korean issue and vacillating with a short-sighted view, will clearly see how the DPRK will set right the international justice and principle in the future.
					
					 Sacred is the strength of the guardian preserving the  dignity of the country, security of the region and global peace with treasured sword of nuclear deterrent for justice and ever-lasting is the truth of the cause of Juche Korea that had access to nukes.

articles.title: U.S. Trick Will Not Work on DPRK: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Trick Will Not Work on DPRK: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is playing a cheap trick in its relations with the DPRK.
					 Recently a high-ranking official concerned of the U.S. State Department "officially" told that the U.S. decided to exclude the idea of preemptive attack on the DPRK from its planned policy toward the DPRK now under examination.
					
					 As if to prove it, the paid media trumpeted in unison that "U.S. shows softened attitude to north Korea".
					
					 It is great irony to see the wolf whose nature is to bite off bleating.
					
					 The U.S. rhetoric about "exclusion of preemptive attack" is nothing but a trick to calm down the DPRK taking the stand of the toughest counteraction and then attack it with surprise preemptive nuclear strike and thus put whole Korea under its control.
					
					 Nothing surprising is the U.S. trite method by which it staged smear campaign to make its rival get relaxed and harbor illusion about the U.S. and then invade it through preemptive attack.
					
					 On June 24, 1950, the U.S. trumpeted about weekend trips of the U.S. president and warmongers like the chief of the U.S. military advisory group in south Korea. On the other hand, it instigated the Syngman Rhee clique to release a false report that the two thirds of the south Korean puppet military had been on an outing and first-line officers and high-ranking officials of the ground army command had been indulged themselves in entertainment at an officers' club. Then on June 25, it provoked the Korean War without declaration of it.
					
					 On the eve of the Iraqi war in the new century, the U.S. conducted smear propaganda campaign against Iraq 17 hours a day at five different frequencies for the purpose of weakening the will of resistance among the army and people of Iraq and creating illusion about the U.S. military among them. After that it started a war through preemptive attack by cruise missiles.
					
					 The deception of the rhetoric about "exclusion of preemptive attack" made by the U.S. is proven with added clarity through the contents of the military operations pursued by the empire of evil against the DPRK, and performance and deployment of strike means.
					
					 Now the U.S. is carrying out Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises under the scenario of preemptive strike like OPLAN 5015 and OPLAN 4D targeting "precision strike" at key strategic strongholds including the supreme headquarters and nuclear and missile bases in the DPRK.
					
					 They are openly describing the nuclear strategic assets involved in the exercises as "ideal preemptive strike means" and are unhesitatingly carrying out "special operation" drills targeting the headquarters of the Korean revolution by setting in motion heinous group of murderers.
					
					 An assertion that preemptive attack has to be pushed forward in secrecy is heard from the U.S. policy-makers, a clear proof that the U.S. ambition to stifle the DPRK and its strategy for a preemptive attack remain unchanged and that the story now afloat is a prelude to an armed invasion.
					
					 The U.S. is seriously mistaken if it thinks it can shake the will of retaliation of the army and people of the DPRK through such a trite trick and deceive the international community.
					
					 The powerful revolutionary Paektusan army is closely following the every move of the hostile forces after putting the strongholds of aggression and provocation within the optical sight of its nuclear weapons.
					
					 If the slightest sign of preemptive attack on the DPRK is detected, the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK will punish the enemies with powerful preemptive nuclear strikes.
					
					 The U.S. should clearly understand the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by the reckless attempt at preemptive strike and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S., S. Korean Forces for Repeating History of Setbacks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S., S. Korean Forces for Repeating History of Setbacks 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are getting frantic in their moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK. This amounts to reckless acts of repeating their history woven with shame and setbacks, ignorant of what sign of ruin is befalling them.
					 Rodong Sinmun on Wednesday says this in an article. It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has experienced only setbacks in the showdown with the DPRK.
					
					 It threatened and blackmailed the DPRK with nuclear stick and appeased it with dollars, but it has never succeeded in bringing the latter to its knees. On the contrary, it suffered bitter shame in the eyes of the world.
					
					 The same is true of the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 They have gone wild as a shock force in the U.S. campaign for escalating sanctions and pressure on the DPRK like a blind pony. This, however, has got them nowhere.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors blustered quite often that it is a matter of time for "the north to collapse". But it was the Park Geun Hye regime that collapsed.
					
					 After all, their sanctions and pressure on the DPRK ended in tightening the noose around their necks.
					
					 The Obama administration's "strategic patience" policy for the "north's dismantlement of its nukes" and the Park Geun Hye regime's "confidence-building process" aimed to lead the DPRK to "changes and collapse of social system" met final setbacks.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities ratchet up sanctions and pressure upon the DPRK, persistently clinging to the hostile policy, this will only entail tragic consequences of precipitating their miserable end.

articles.title: Crimes of S. Korean Puppet Ministry of Unification Can Never Be Justified: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Crimes of S. Korean Puppet Ministry of Unification Can Never Be Justified: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet ministry of unification in its recent "2017 Unification White Paper" cited the shutdown of the Kaesong Industrial Park (KIP), "sanctions against the north" and adoption of the "law on human rights in the north" as its achievements, claiming that they are attributable to "the nuclear and missile threats from the north".
					 Timed to coincide with this, confrontation maniacs of the ministry such as traitor Hong Yong Phyo raved that their anti-DPRK sanctions and pressure are aimed to lead "the north to changes," describing the DPRK's measures for bolstering up nuclear deterrent for self-defence as a "serious threat and provocation." They uttered that the "government" remains unchanged in its basic stand on "the north's nuclear dismantlement".
					
					 They also talked such nonsense that as long as the "nuclear issue of the north" remains unsettled, "there would not be any dramatic change in the north-south relations" and restart of the KIP "would not be supported by the public" even though the "regime" is changed in south Korea.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says that the above-said rigmaroles are nothing but a shameless attempt to justify their confrontation policy against the nation, persistently pursue it and evade their responsibility for having brought the inter-Korean ties to a collapse.
					
					 No matter what rhetoric they may let out to mislead the public opinion, they can never evade their responsibility for having driven the north-south relations to rock bottom.
					
					 The ministry's noisy trumpeting about the persistent confrontation policy is a blatant challenge to the candlelight actions being held by the south Korean people demanding a total scrapping of all country-selling policies of traitor Park Geun Hye.
					
					 The group of traitors will have to pay for all their acts of driving the inter-Korean ties into a total collapse despite the nation's desire for reunification, stresses the commentary.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy towards U.S.
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy towards U.S.
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group are vociferating about "success" allegedly made through the recent south Korean junket of U.S. Secretary of State Tillerson. 
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday observes:
					
					 It was nothing but the mean diplomacy conducted by human scum and poor servants of the U.S. as they regard sycophancy towards the U.S., confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and begging and submission as their unique mode of existence.
					
					 The south Korean puppet group implored Tillerson to "boost alliance" and "ratchet up pressure on the north." This was a revelation of the sinister intention to hurt the fellow countrymen with the backing of outside forces and prolong their remaining days at the door of death.
					
					 "Closer alliance" with the U.S. touted by the south Korean puppet group would only bring the irrevocable consequences of imposing a nuclear disaster upon the Korean nation as it is, in essence, alliance between the master and servant, humiliating alliance for a war.
					
					 "Pressure on the north" and "strong will for counteraction" about which they talked a great deal were foolish outbursts let out by the confrontation maniacs to cover up the thrice-cursed crimes they committed by driving the north-south relations into a total collapse and stifle the north at any cost.
					
					 The south Korean people can never escape disgrace and insult and the Korean nation can never be free from the danger of a nuclear war as long as the pro-U.S. lackeys and sycophants are allowed to be at large.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Moves
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Moves
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are more desperately imploring their American master for cooperation in pressurizing the DPRK these days.
					 Chief of the security office of Chongwadae Kim Kwan Jin and Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se flew to their American masters one after another, calling for "strengthened policy cooperation including counteraction to cope with nuclear and missile threats from the north" and "continued sanctions and pressure on it."
					
					 The pro-U.S. conservative forces of south Korea, in the meantime, at a confab with White House national security adviser, the chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff and the U.S. chief delegate of the six-party talks called for "close cooperation". Yun Pyong Se held the farce of soliciting "cooperation in international pressure" during his tour of several Asian countries.
					
					 The puppet military warmongers are staging frantic north-targeted war exercises, while clamoring for "closer alliance". On March 12, Chairman of the puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff Ri Sun Jin who boarded the U.S. nuclear carrier Carl Vinson together with his American master blustered that "should the north makes misjudgment and provocation, it will face overwhelming counteraction by 'allies'".
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary derides this as a last-ditch struggling of a group of sycophants and deranged men keen on isolating and stifling the DPRK at any cost and prolonging their remaining days even with the help of the U.S. master.
					
					 The paper says:
					
					 It is undeniable truth proven through the several decades-old DPRK-U.S. stand-off that neither sanctions nor military pressure will work on the DPRK. It's a clumsy hysteric act of the remnants of Park Geun Hye ahead of the most miserable end to try to go against this truth.
					
					 The commentary stresses that it is the inevitability of history that the group of traitors keen on sordid farce of soliciting cooperation against their fellow countrymen are bound to go to ruin, rejected and denounced by all.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Roll back Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Roll back Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Media and experts on Korean issue of various countries are expressing their wide-ranging views on the DPRK-U.S. relations which have become the focus of the world politics at present.
					 A review of those viewpoints comes to the conclusion that the evil cycle of the DPRK-U.S. relations has historically been attributable to the U.S. incompetence and that the Trump administration has to opt for negotiations with the DPRK at an early date as Washington's persistent military option would entail a fatal disaster.
					
					 A commentary of Minju Joson Wednesday observes: This indicates the grim bilateral relations and that the U.S. administration now stands at crossroads at which it has to take a responsible approach towards its relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Noting that the Trump administration is openly disclosing its attempt at dealing with the DPRK from the strong-arm stand just like the successive administrations, the commentary goes on:
					
					 Clear is the answer of the DPRK to this issue, i.e. strength is not all-mighty and nuclear weapons are not the monopoly of the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK has not yielded to the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail even at a time when it had no access to nuclear weapons. Now it has powerful nuclear strike means capable of wiping out aggressors and reducing the strongholds of evil to ashes in no time.
					
					 Then how should the U.S. deal with the DPRK. Washington has to find out an answer to it.
					
					 As the dialogue partner, the DPRK's warning to the U.S. is that Pyongyang is ready for everything.
					
					 The commentary stresses that the U.S. had better opt for a switchover in its DPRK policy by abandoning its hostile policy if it does not want to take a wrong step and face a catastrophic fate.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Calls for Strictly Dealing with Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Calls for Strictly Dealing with Park Geun Hye
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Tuesday in an editorial called for strictly dealing with  traitor Park Geun Hye.
					 Referring to the fact that the prosecution asked a warrant of arrest for Park on Mar. 27, the editorial called for strictly punishing ousted Park Geun Hye by law to eliminate her deep-rooted evils.

articles.title: S. Korea: Women Urged to Turn out in Struggle for Peace
articles.content:
S. Korea: Women Urged to Turn out in Struggle for Peace
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Women's Society for Achieving Peace held a rally in Seoul on Monday to mark the 20th anniversary of its formation, according to the south Korean online newspaper Tongil News.
					 Speakers at the rally noted that the organization has waged diverse activities for exchange between the women in the south and the north and for peace of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 They said that the dream of the women in south Korea is to travel freely as far as the north and the dream would surely come true.
					
					 Today the north-south exchange and cooperation are in a difficult situation but dialogue for peace should not be stopped, they stressed.
					
					 Saying only positive actions for peace can stop the war, they called on the women to strive hard for achieving peace and building a just society.

articles.title: S. Korean Bodies Protest against Repression of Reunification Champion
articles.content:
S. Korean Bodies Protest against Repression of Reunification Champion
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations in Kwangju of south Korea held a press conference on March 27 to protest against the puppet police's violent suppression of a pro-reunification activist, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 The Kwangju Police Agency searched the house of a resident in Namgu, Kwangju City on March 20 on the suspicion of possession and distribution of "literature benefiting enemy" and launched an investigation into the person by mobilizing the Security Investigation Group. 
					
					 At the press conference the person vowed to struggle till the day when the people desirous of reunification can lead a worthy life free from the "Security Law". 
					
					 The speakers demanded the police stop at once the suppression by the "Security Law".

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Demanded by Koreans Bodies in Europe
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Demanded by Koreans Bodies in Europe
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany and the European Regional Headquarters of Overseas Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification made public a joint statement on Mar. 27 in protest against the joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces for aggression.
					 The statement said that the dangerous Key Resolve, Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises staged by them annually are bringing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the brink of a war.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty as soon as possible and pull back its troops from south Korea.

articles.title: General Meeting of U.S. Headquarters of Pomminryon
articles.content:
General Meeting of U.S. Headquarters of Pomminryon
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) held the 27th general meeting of its central members on March 26.
					 Chairman of the Headquarters Paek Sung Bae made a speech at the meeting.
					
					 He said that the national reunification is the way for the nation to live and it is the road of making a contribution to the world peace.
					
					 He underscored the need for the south and the north to hasten the national reunification by implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 Declaration by concerted efforts, adding that the headquarters would continue waging a dynamic reunification movement including activities for successfully holding the pan-national conference this year, too.
					
					 The general meeting reviewed the work done last year when the headquarters conducted activities to support the proposal for opening the joint conference of political parties, organizations and personages in the north and the south and abroad for the peace and independent reunification of the Korean peninsula and voice solidarity with the reunification movement organizations and discussed the orientation of this year's work.
					
					 A statement was read out under the title of "Let's put an end to the south Korea-U.S. joint military drills and usher in a new day for the nation".
					
					 The statement said that the joint military drills staged by the south Korean and U.S. authorities were undisguised moves to ignite a nuclear war.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Iran
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Iran
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Hadian Publishing House of Iran brought out in pamphlet respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" on March 20 ahead of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The work, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and indicates the tasks for successfully accomplishing the cause of the Songun revolution.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Thailand
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Thailand
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A Thai preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President     Kim Il Sung, was formed on Mar. 21.
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including seminar, lecture meeting and film show.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Peru
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Peru
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President     Kim Il Sung, was formed in Lima on Mar. 20.
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland) who is chairman of the Peruvian preparatory committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including meeting, workshop and film show ahead of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Denounced by Nigerian Figure
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Denounced by Nigerian Figure
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Damian Ogbonna, national chairman of the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria who is co-chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu and chairman of the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, released a statement on March 22 in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korea joint military drills.
					 The statement said that the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria fully supports the principled stand of the DPRK against the largest-ever joint military drills being staged by the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 As the joint military drills are an undisguised game for preemptive nuclear attack aimed to overthrow the system of the sovereign state, it is a reasonable right of the DPRK to self-defence to strongly counter it.
					
					 The U.S. tries to make the public convince the above-said drills are due to the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons. This is a profound confusing of right and wrong.
					
					 We strongly denounce the dangerous war exercises which will inflict nuclear disaster not only on the Korean peninsula but also on the world.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities should respond to the DPRK's proposal for removing the danger of war from the Korean peninsula and the region and creating a peaceful environment with a stop to the aggressive war drills.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del embajador de Eslovenia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del embajador de Eslovenia
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, recibio el dia 29 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Eslovenia en la RPDC.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Tiene lugar encuentro de informacion de situacion para diplomaticos europeos
articles.content:
Tiene lugar encuentro de informacion de situacion para diplomaticos europeos
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Son Gyong, jefe del Departamento 2 de Europa del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sostuvo el dia 28 el encuentro con los representantes diplomaticos de los paises miembros de la Union Europea acreditados en la RPDC y les informo la grave situacion creada en estos dias en la Peninsula Coreana.
					Kim se refirio a la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana que llega al borde de la guerra debido a EE.UU que introdujo gran cantidad de propiedades estrategicas y desarrolla junto con los titeres surcoreanos los ejercicios conjuntos militares Key Resolve y Foal Eagle de mayor envergadura con el objetivo de practicar la "operacion de descabezamiento" y la de "ocupacion de Pyongyang" y hablo de las contramedidas autodefensivas de la RPDC para hacer frente a ello.
					
					Y subrayo que ya paso la epoca en que una parte obligaba algo a la otra y que la RPDC tiene la voluntad y capacidad para contestar con gusto a cualquier guerra deseada por EE.UU.
					
					Los diplomaticos europeos expresaron la profunda preocupacion por la agravacion de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y desearon el alivio de la tension mediante el dialogo.

articles.title: Efectuada ceremonia de graduacion en Escuela Internacional de Futbol
articles.content:
Efectuada ceremonia de graduacion en Escuela Internacional de Futbol
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 29 la ceremonia de graduacion del primer periodo de la Escuela Internacional de Futbol de Pyongyang.
					A la ocasion asistieron Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del CC del PTC, los funcionarios de ramas interesadas, los profesores, empleados, cursantes y graduandos de la escuela, asi como sus familiares.
					
					En su discurso de la ocasion, Choe felicito a los graduandos quienes crecieron como futbolistas prometedores de reserva cultivando a sus anchas sus suenos y dotes en la Escuela Internacional de Futbol de Pyongyang, base de formacion de futbolistas de reserva.
					
					Recomendaron a los graduandos que muestren sus talentos adiestrados en la excelente escuela y enarbolen la bandera nacional en los torneos internacionales.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los graduandos plantaron arboles para conmemorar el dia de despedida.

articles.title: Inaugurado Campeonato Nacional de Artes Marciales por Premio Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Inaugurado Campeonato Nacional de Artes Marciales por Premio Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia del Sol (natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung), quedo iniciado en esta capital el Campeonato Nacional de Artes Marciales por el Premio Mangyongdae.
					En el certamen, que se realizara en la Villa de Taekwondo, tomaran parte mas de 600 jugadores de ambos sexos seleccionados en mas de 20 entidades incluso los equipos de taekwondocas de todas las localidades del pais.
					
					Los participantes rivalizaran en las competencias de Taekwondo, Paduk y otras disciplinas de artes marciales.
					
					La ceremonia de apertura tuvo lugar el dia 29 en el Centro de Baloncesto de la capitalina Avenida Chongchun con la participacion de Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidentes del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, los funcionarios interesados, jugadores, entrenadores y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					El discurso de apertura estuvo a cargo de Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea.
					
					Terminado el acto, se ofrecio la presentacion modelo de los taekwondocas del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea.
